title: Question 24
prompt: Which writer is most likely to oppose the return of Egyptian artifacts from museums to the Egyptian government?
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
While Writer A mentions looting and plunder and Writer C compares Drovetti to a treasure hunter, Writer B emphasizes the value to the world of Drovetti’s finds. This writer might be less likely to place a high importance on the Egyptian government’s claim to artifacts that are on display in a museum.

Bernardino Drovetti served as the French Consul-General in Egypt between 1802 and 1814. Drovetti financed Egyptian excavations that enhanced the world’s understanding of Ancient Egypt and provided the world with precious archeological treasures that formed the foundation of the Egyptian Museum in Turin.
